election_record.label: New York 1817 State Senate, Western District

overview.note: "On the 27th Feb. last, Mr Frey of the Senate, from the committee of election, to who was referred the petition of Jediah Prendergast, reported as follows, to wit: That from a careful inspection of the return of votes for Senators, given at the late election in the Western district on file in the office of Secretary of State, it appears that there were given on said election, for Isaac Wilson, 15009 votes and for Jediah Prendergast, 14985 votes; leaving a majority in favor of the said Isaac Wilson of 24 votes. It further appears that on said election, were also given for Jedediah Prendergast 91 votes, and for Jed Prendergast 10 votes. That it likewise appears to the entire satisfaction of your committee, that 42 votes of the said 91, given for Jediah Prendergast, were received by the inspectors of said election, in the town of Parma, in the county of Genesee and that the name Jedediah contained thereon was so written by mistake; and that the said 42 votes were intended to be give for said memorialist. The committee further reports, that it also appear to them that said memorialist is frequently written to and called Jedediah and as it is not alleged that there is any person of that name in the Western District, the committee suppose it correct to presume that the others voted for Jedediah Prendergast and for Jed Prendergast were likewise intended for the said memorialist. The committee therefore, beg leave to recommend the adoption of the following resolution. Resolved, that Isaac Wilson, Esq. a senator from the Western district is not entitled to a seat in this Senate for four years. Resolved, that Jediah Prendergast, a senator from the Western district, is entitled to a seat in this house for four years. Henry J. Frey, Chairman. The above report and resolutions were yesterday taken up in Senate in committee of the whole, and after a warm and animated discussion of several hours, rejected by a small majority. It is therefore decided that Mr. Wilson retain his seat. Messrs. Van Vechten, Ross and Bates, spoke in favor of the claim of Mr. Prendergast, and Messrs. Skinner, Young and Van Buren contra." Niagara Journal (Buffalo, NY). May 12, 1818.

"The Election, in this State, opens to-day, and under circumstances never before witnessed since the people divided into two great political parties. There is but one candidate for the first office, and in most of the counties, the strife for members of the Legislature is confined to the present ruling party. It is not probable that many of the federalists will go to the polls, except in counties and districts where federal candidates are nominated. --This course is believed to be dictated by sound policy--It is not, as Mr. Coleman would infer, that 'federalism is abandoned in the Western District'--but that opposition, after what we have experienced, is considered worse than useless--serving only to draw out and consolidate the whole force of democracy, which otherwise would, from its inconsistency, divide and fall to pieces." Ontario Repository (Canandaigua, NY). April 29, 1817.

sub_unit.name: Allegany
sub_unit.note: Jediah Prendergast received 10 vote as Jed Prendergast, 25 votes as Jedediah Penterghast and 7 votes as Jedediah Prendergast.

sub_unit.name: Cayuga
sub_unit.note: The New York Columbian lists 1828 votes for Jediah Prendergast and 1949 votes for Isaac Wilson.

sub_unit.name: Aurelius
sub_unit.note: The Auburn Gazette (Auburn, NY) lists 339 votes for Isaac Wilson.

sub_unit.name: Owasco
sub_unit.note: The Auburn Gazette (Auburn, NY) lists 45 votes for Isaac Wilson.

sub_unit.name: Sterling
sub_unit.note: The returns from Sterling town were not counted in the Official State Wide Canvass.

sub_unit.name: Chautauque
sub_unit.note: The Columbian and The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) list 408 votes for Jediah Prendergast.
Jediah Prendergast received 1 vote as Jand Prendergast.

sub_unit.name: Portland
sub_unit.note: Jediah Prendergast received 9 votes as Jedediah Prendergast.

sub_unit.name: Genesee
sub_unit.note: The New York Columbian lists 3002 votes for Jediah Prendergast.
The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) lists 2009 votes for Jediah Prendergast.
Jediah Prendergast received 50 votes as Jedediah Prendergast.

sub_unit.name: Madison
sub_unit.note: Isaac C. Wilson received 11 votes as Wilson.
Jediah Prendergast received 1 vote as Jediah Prenderhast.
Myron Holly received 1 vote as Myron Hawley.

sub_unit.name: Oneida
sub_unit.note: Isaac C. Wilson and Jediah Prendergast received 2 votes each that were not originally credited to them because the office for which they were intended was not designated.
Jediah Prendergast received 1 vote as Jediah Prendershast.
Myron Holly received 3 votes as Myron Hawley.

sub_unit.name: Ontario
sub_unit.note: Isaac C. Wilson and Jediah Prendergast received 65 votes each that were not originally credited to them because the office for which they were intended was not designated.

sub_unit.name: Junius
sub_unit.note: Jediah Prendergast received 9 votes as Jedadiah Prendergast and 1 vote as Jared Prendergast.

sub_unit.name: Tompkins
sub_unit.note: The Official Canvass of votes lists Isaac Wilson with 1334 votes, though the town votes add up to 1148 votes.
Landmarks of Tompkins County New York lists 1010 votes for Jediah Prendergast, though the town votes add up to 997.
The History of Tioga, Chemung, Tompkins, and Schuyler Counties, New York lists 1016 votes for Jediah Prendergast, though the town votes add up to 997.

sub_unit.name: Hector
sub_unit.note: Isaac Wilson received 1 vote as Isaac Wilson.

election_record.reference: Original Election Books. Steuben County Court House, Bath.
The Advocate of the People (Auburn, NY). May 7, 1817.
The New-York Columbian (New York, NY). May 19, 1817.
The New-York Columbian (New York, NY). May 31, 1817.
The New-York Columbian (New York, NY). June 14, 1817.

History of Tioga, Chemung, Tompkins and Schuyler Counties New York. Philadelphia: Everts and Ensign 1879. 380.
